intro: Homolepis glutinosa, commonly known as stickyleaf or stickyseed plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its glandular leaves that exude a sticky substance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous tiny, dry seeds. The sticky leaves and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
